tool_description: Financial data provided for developers, to enter the world markets. Instant access for real-time and historical data of stocks, forex, crypto, ETFs, indices, and more. Read more in [documentation](https://twelvedata.com/docs) and start [here](https://twelvedata.com/apikey).

api_list.description:

api_list.name: MFs List
api_list.description:
This API request returns a list of mutual funds available at Twelve Data. Sorting is in descending order by total assets value. The list is updated daily.

With Basic, Pro, and Ultra plans, only 50 records will be in response. Mega and Custom plans can access complete data on over 200,000 Mutual Funds.

api_list.name: Market Movers - ETFs
api_list.description:
Get the list of the top gaining or losing ETFs today.

Top gainers are ordered by the highest rate of price increase since the previous day's close. Top losers are ordered by the highest percentage of price decrease since the last day.

Availability: Ultra plan
Data weighting: 100 API credits per symbol

optional_parameters.name: country
optional_parameters.description:
Country of the snapshot, applicable to non-currencies only

Takes country name or alpha code; default `USA`

optional_parameters.name: outputsize
optional_parameters.description:
Specifies the size of the snapshot

Can be in a range from `1` to `50`; default `30`

optional_parameters.name: direction
optional_parameters.description:
Specifies the direction of the snapshot `gainers` or `losers`

By `default` gainers

optional_parameters.name: dp
optional_parameters.description:
Specifies the number of decimal places for floating values

Should be in range `[0,11]` inclusive; default `5`

Default `30`, Max `120`

api_list.name: Technical Indicators Interface
api_list.description: This API call return array of objects with available technical indicators. This endpoint might be used to build an abstract interface to make more convenient API calls from the application.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://twelve-data1.p.rapidapi.com/technical_indicators"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "twelve-data1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://twelve-data1.p.rapidapi.com/technical_indicators"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "twelve-data1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
